instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot 40ma
threads.message:
Hello,

We have a Macbook Air not powering on. 
Draws 40ma

We have PP3v3S5 but no S4 rails
S4 Power Enable is missing 

PM SLP S5 L is 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.44v
SMC RESET L 3.4v

Is this SMC issue?

SMC is not hot.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot 40ma
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot 40ma
threads.message:
What means second post???

Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>?
Check voltages and signals for <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (2 of 2) at page 37.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot 40ma
threads.message: The second post is for our internal reference so I could tie it to the thread. It's a "board only" job so no customer or anything visual to tell it apart from the other jobs. :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot 40ma
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.6v
PP3V3 S5 SMC VDDA 3.43v
<SIGNAL>SMC_WAKE_L</SIGNAL> 3.089v
<SIGNAL>SMC_CLK32K</SIGNAL> 1.732
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL> 1.2V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3.3V
SMC TCK 3.43
SMC TMS 3.43
SMC TDO 3.42
<SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> 3.43
SMC EXTAL 100mv
<SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL</SIGNAL> 80mv
